page.title: 03ST.MARY'S CHURCH I
page.content: ST. MARY'S CHURCH. Every pew in St. Mary's church is differently carved.The oak wood comes from Earl Cowper's estate in Panshanger.In Germany there is a place called Oberammagau.That is where the pews were carved.The pews are beautifully carved.Leaning on the pews are two poles for the church wardens to use.If somebody did something wrong they could go to the sanctuary.Then they would be safe,but only for a year and a day.The sanctuary rails are made of alabaster.The front is also made of alabaster.The oldest part of the church is the chansel which is about 700 years old.It is true that the last person convicted of being a witch was buried in the churchyard.Jane came from Walkern in Welwyn.No one can find Jane Wenham because she had no head stone.She wasn't given a head stone...
